meanings.definition: The state of being embarrassed or ashamed.
meanings.sent1: Her abashment was evident from the blush on her cheeks.
meanings.sent2: His abashment was clear when he realized his mistake.
meanings.sent3: The abashment on her face was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: His abashment painted a vivid picture of his inner turmoil.
meanings.sent5: The abashment she felt was unforgettable and haunting.

meanings.definition: The act of causing someone to feel embarrassed or ashamed.
meanings.sent1: His teasing led to her abashment in front of the whole class.
meanings.sent2: The prank was meant to bring abashment to the unsuspecting victim.
meanings.sent3: The abashment caused by the practical joke was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The abashment he inflicted was like a sharp dagger to her pride.
meanings.sent5: The abashment he caused lingered long after the incident.
